meta.message: Generated a list of potential causes based on user profile and health concern.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Manage stress through relaxation techniques and mindfulness.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Stress and emotional strain can affect immune function and may contribute to skin conditions like psoriasis.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Maintain a balanced diet rich in anti-inflammatory foods.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Dietary choices can influence inflammation levels in the body, potentially impacting psoriasis symptoms.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Prioritize regular, restful sleep to support skin health.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Poor sleep quality can impair immune regulation and may worsen skin conditions.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Engage in regular moderate exercise to improve overall health.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Physical activity can reduce stress and improve circulation, which may benefit skin health.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Minimize exposure to harsh weather and irritants.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Environmental triggers such as cold, dry air, or irritants can aggravate psoriasis.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Use gentle skin care products and avoid harsh chemicals.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Aggressive skin products can irritate skin and potentially worsen psoriasis.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Monitor hormonal changes and consult healthcare providers if needed.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Hormonal fluctuations may influence skin condition in young women.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Incorporate relaxing activities and ensure work-life balance.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Mental fatigue and imbalance can impact immune health and skin conditions.
